headline: Easy Standing Rib Roast
description: This easy standing rib roast is succulent and full of flavor. A sea salt, black pepper, and fresh garlic crust complements the juicy meat perfectly.
name: Easy Standing Rib Roast
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed
2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). Set a rack inside a shallow roasting pan.
Brush rib roast lightly with olive oil, then rub sea salt, pepper, and garlic all over. Place onto the rack with the fatty side facing up.

Roast in the preheated oven until browned, about 30 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and tent the pan with aluminum foil. Continue cooking until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the rib roast registers 140 degrees (60 degrees C) for medium, about 1 hour (or 15 minutes per pound if your roast is a different size).
Remove from the oven and let stand for 10 to 20 minutes, then remove the foil and carve.

review.reviewBody: This was a winner! I pretty much followed the recipe, and added quartered onions, potatoes, carrots, and brussels sprouts to the roasting pan. It took longer to cook than anticipated, and was over 170 degrees when checked with a thermometer. I thought that it might be overcooked, but was nice and pink inside. It was delicious and perfect.
It was easy and incredibly tasty. I am in the process of doing another roast for my adult children. Together with Greek salad and rice.

Loved this recipe because it was easy to do and made for a tender delicious meat for our Christmas meal! Because we were out of olive oil had to substitute canola oil and did not see a drastic change in flavor! Was still very good!

Best ever way of making standing rib roast. Usually I use the first two ribs of the small end of the roast with the rib cut and tied back. For medium rare I will be oven on 500° for 30 minutes. Then turn off and leave it sit for about two hours and then heat to 375° for 30 minutes.

It was perfect! Mine was a 9.4 pound roast but no issues! I even started it in the oven at the 475 temp and then for 2 hours left it at the 325 temp. When I returned from Christmas Eve service I had to put it on the grill to finish as I needed the oven for a pie. My grill baked 2 turkeys in roasting pans at Thanksgiving so I knew it would be no trouble with this roast. Perfection!

This is a terrific recipe. First time I’ve made a standing rib roast so I thought I’d try a basic recipe. This worked out great. The only think was I had to cook at 325 for about 90 Minutes to get the meat done to medium to medium well.
I had to leave the pepper out of it and I added some basil. It was excellent. It took a little longer than I thought but it was time well spent.
I added a few variations to the recipe. I would take out the oven at 130 degrees to maintain that pink in the middle and let the juices settle into the meat for 20-30 minutes.
